points.title: Only for personal and non-commercial use

tosdr.tldr: Your use of the service is restricted with “a limited license to access, share, tag and save to your Account any Member Content (including another Member's public “bookmarks”) for your personal and non-commercial use”.
tosdr.case: only for your individual and non-commercial use

topics.name: Governance
topics.subtitle: Your relationship with the service and the community
topics.title: Governance

points.title: No Right to leave the service

tosdr.tldr: Even if you terminate your account, Delicious “may retain an archived copy for legitimate business purposes”. The copyright license does not end.
tosdr.case: no right to leave the service

topics.description: Once you subscribe to the service, will you have the right to leave it and remove your data?
topics.name: Right to leave the service
topics.subtitle: To avoid lock-in and stay in control
topics.title: Right to leave the service

points.title: Delicious can license your content to third-parties

tosdr.tldr: The scope of the copyright license granted to Delicious includes the rights to transfer and sublicense. This means your content can be licensed by Delicious to third-parties on their terms.
tosdr.case: broad license including right to distribute through any media

topics.description: Copyright law gives you control over how your content (texts, photos, videos, etc.) can be used, by whom they can be distributed, modified, etc. Sometimes, online services need your permission to perform certain tasks with your content. That's why they ask you to grant them a copyright license. But sometimes, the copyright license is so broad, that your content can be exploited by others without asking you.
topics.name: Scope of the copyright license
topics.subtitle: Do you grant only the necessary rights?
topics.title: Scope of the copyright license

points.title: Non-transparent use of cookies and third party ads

tosdr.tldr: Data collected with cookies is kept for an undefined period of time. Also, Delicious' “Third party advertisers may also place or read cookies on your browser.”

topics.description: Cookies are files stored locally in your web browser containing identifiable information.
topics.name: Cookies
topics.subtitle: and related technologies
topics.title: Cookies

points.title: Your personal information are an asset for business transfers

tosdr.tldr: Delicious “may sell, transfer or otherwise share some or all of its assets, including your Personal Information, in connection with a merger, acquisition, reorganization or sale of assets or in the event of bankruptcy.”
tosdr.case: may sell your data in merger

topics.description: When you give your data to a company, you need to keep in mind that this company can get acquired by another company, with different policies. What happens in that case?
topics.name: Business Transfers
topics.subtitle: Is your data a business asset?
topics.title: Business Transfers

points.title: Very broad copyright license on your content, includes right for Delicious to distribute through any media

tosdr.tldr: The copyright license granted to Delicious is not limited to operating the service. Your content can be exploited “in any and all media or distribution channels (now known or hereafter created)” i.e. it can be distributed by Delicious outside the Delicious service.
tosdr.case: broad license including right to distribute through any media

topics.description: Copyright law gives you control over how your content (texts, photos, videos, etc.) can be used, by whom they can be distributed, modified, etc. Sometimes, online services need your permission to perform certain tasks with your content. That's why they ask you to grant them a copyright license. But sometimes, the copyright license is so broad, that your content can be exploited by others without asking you.
